Join us for open conversation and solidarity in the wake of this decision.
  


Community Forum on SCOTUS Muslim Ban Decision

Tuesday, July 10, 7-9 p.m.
UNH Law School
2 White St.
Concord, NH 03301

RSVP TODAY
Share this:           

Dear ##first_name[Supporter]##,

Last week, the United States Supreme Court allowed the Muslim ban to continue. In a 5-4 ruling, the justices sided with this cornerstone of Trump's discriminatory immigration policy. The latest version of the ban limits entry to the United States from citizens of five Muslim-majority countries in addition to a number of North Koreans and Venezuelans.

Join us on Tuesday, July 10 at UNH Law School, as we work in coalition with community partners to provide a space for open conversation and solidarity in the wake of this decision. The forum will include Robert Azzi, a Lebanese-American Muslim who curates "Ask a Muslim Anything" town halls across New Hampshire; Asma Elhuni, a Libyan-American Muslim woman and community organizer with United Valley Interfaith Project; Devon Chaffee, executive director of the ACLU of New Hampshire; and you!

Let us be clear. This is a loss, but this is not the end of the fight. We are committed to taking down this discriminatory ban on every front — in Congress, in the courts, and in the streets!

Join us on Tuesday, July 10 at UNH Law School!

In solidarity,

Christina Gibson
Public Affairs Manager
ACLU of New Hampshire
